articles.author: CLAUDIA LAUER and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WILMINGTON, Del. (AP) — Hunter Biden's legal woes are not over after his conviction on three felony firearms charges in a trial that put a spotlight on his drug-fueled past.
articles.title: What's next for Hunter Biden after his conviction on federal gun charges

articles.author: BASSEM MROUE and JACK JEFFERY
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Lebanon's Hezbollah fired a massive barrage of rockets into northern Israel on Wednesday to avenge the killing of a top commander, further escalating regional tensions as the fate of an internationally-backed plan for a cease-fire in Gaza hung in the balance.
articles.title: Hezbollah fires scores of rockets at northern Israel as Gaza cease-fire talks hang in the balance

articles.author: CLAUDIA LAUER and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WILMINGTON, Del. (AP) — Hunter Biden's legal woes are not over after his conviction on three felony firearms charges in a trial that put a spotlight on his drug-fueled past.
articles.title: What's next for Hunter Biden after his conviction on federal gun charges

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER and REBECCA SANTANA
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Eight people from Tajikistan with suspected ties to the Islamic State group have been arrested in the United States in recent days, according to multiple people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: AP sources: 8 people with possible Islamic State ties arrested in US on immigration violations

articles.author: HYUNG-JIN KIM
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — North Korean leader Kim Jong Un hailed the country’s expanding relationship with Russia on Wednesday, as reports suggest that Russian President Vladimir Putin will soon visit the country for his third meeting with Kim.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim hails Russia ties as Putin reportedly plans a visit

articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — At least 41 people died when a fire swept through a building that housed workers in Kuwait early Wednesday, and officials said the blaze appeared to be linked to code violations.
articles.title: At least 41 die in a fire at a building housing workers in Kuwait

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: MECCA, Saudi Arabia (AP) — Muslim pilgrims have been streaming into Saudi Arabia's holy city of Mecca ahead of the start of the Hajj later this week, as the annual pilgrimage returns to its monumental scale.
articles.title: More than 1.5 million foreign Muslims arrive in Mecca for annual Hajj pilgrimage

articles.author: DAVID KLEPPER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — When disinformation researcher Wen-Ping Liu looked into China's efforts to influence Taiwan's recent election using fake social media accounts, something unusual stood out about the most successful profiles.
articles.title: Faking an honest woman: Why Russia, China and Big Tech all use faux females to get clicks

articles.description: ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) — Survivors and the families of victims of the Pulse nightclub massacre had hoped by now to have a permanent memorial in place for Wednesday's eighth anniversary of the attack by a lone gunman who killed 49 people at the gay-friendly club in Orlando, Florida.
articles.title: After years of delays, scaled-back plans underway for memorial to Florida nightclub massacre

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER RUGABER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Federal Reserve officials on Wednesday will likely make official what's been clear for many weeks: With inflation sticking at a level above their 2% target, they are downgrading their outlook for interest rate cuts.
articles.title: Federal Reserve is likely to scale back plans for rate cuts because of persistent inflation
